title: spack buildcache doesn't clean up on failure?
body:
Apparently a failed `spack buildcache` command leaves the working directory in a possibly broken state, that must be cleaned manually.

### Expected Result

I expect either:

1. The command does not exit with an error (just a warning), and creates the build cache
2. The command exits with an error and the build cache is not created

### Actual Result

The command creates a tarball in:
```console
$ tree build_cache/
build_cache/
├── linux-ubuntu14.04-x86_64
│   └── gcc-4.8
│       └── zlib-1.2.11
│           └── linux-ubuntu14.04-x86_64-gcc-4.8-zlib-1.2.11-eksallf6cymqkp6pkz6ymzjakqt6bqkx.tar.gz
└── linux-ubuntu14.04-x86_64-gcc-4.8-zlib-1.2.11-eksallf6cymqkp6pkz6ymzjakqt6bqkx.spec.yaml
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack buildcache create zlib
==> adding matching spec zlib@1.2.11%gcc@4.8+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-ubuntu14.04-x86_64 
==> recursing dependencies
==> adding dependency zlib@1.2.11%gcc@4.8+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-ubuntu14.04-x86_64 
==> creating binary cache file for package zlib@1.2.11%gcc@4.8+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-ubuntu14.04-x86_64  
==> Error: no default key available for signing, use -y to create unsigned build caches or spack gpg init to create a default key

$ spack buildcache create zlib
==> adding matching spec zlib@1.2.11%gcc@4.8+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-ubuntu14.04-x86_64 
==> recursing dependencies
==> adding dependency zlib@1.2.11%gcc@4.8+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-ubuntu14.04-x86_64 
==> creating binary cache file for package zlib@1.2.11%gcc@4.8+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-ubuntu14.04-x86_64  
==> Warning: /home/mculpo/PycharmProjects/spack/build_cache/linux-ubuntu14.04-x86_64-gcc-4.8-zlib-1.2.11-eksallf6cymqkp6pkz6ymzjakqt6bqkx.spec.yaml exists, use -f to force overwrite.
```

### Information on your system
Using 20092adb944615b96e4265d5d23627f91b2d5c58 with default configuration on:
```console
$ uname -a
Linux nuvolari 4.4.0-98-generic #121~14.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Wed Oct 11 11:54:55 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```
